meanings.definition: Serving as a perfect example or representation of something.
meanings.sent1: The small, bright flower was epitomical of beauty in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness towards everyone was epitomical of a true friend.
meanings.sent3: The epitomical cat wearing a tiny hat made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His calm demeanor in the storm was epitomical of a wise sailor.
meanings.sent5: The epitomical sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Representing the best or most typical example of a particular quality or type.
meanings.sent1: The old oak tree in the park was epitomical of strength and resilience.
meanings.sent2: Her homemade apple pie was epitomical of delicious desserts.
meanings.sent3: The epitomical clown with oversized shoes made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His vintage car was epitomical of a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The epitomical mountain peak stood majestically against the sky.
